Breadth-First.Explanation: Divergent exploration listing broad location options (Germany, US, elsewhere) with no firm hypothesis
Hypothesis generation mode—considering multiple parks (Munich, Berlin, London, Amsterdam) and leaning toward Vondelpark without detailed verification
Broadly exploring many park possibilities across Europe and the US based on path and lighting clues

Depth-First.Explanation: Focusing on a single hypothesis (Vondelpark) and planning targeted verification
Depth-First.KeyElement: Hypothesis: Vondelpark’s ponds with reeds and poplar trees

Depth-First.Explanation: Comparing specific features of Westpark and Vondelpark against the image to eliminate mismatches
Depth-First.KeyElement: Pond features vs amphitheater, benches, fountains

Depth-First.Explanation: Detailed feature matching (iris, reeds, lampposts, benches, planting palette) to confirm Vondelpark
Depth-First.KeyElement: Stands of yellow-flag iris, common reed, lamppost design

Depth-First.Explanation: Final confirmation statement of the location
Depth-First.KeyElement: Definitive naming of Vondelpark, Oud-Zuid, Amsterdam

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Moved from listing many candidate parks to focusing on verifying Vondelpark specifically
After detailed comparison of two parks, reopened exploration to consider additional park candidates
